intro: Triadenum purpureum, commonly known as the purple triadenum, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its small, clustered inflorescences bloom in shades of pink to purple, adding ornamental value to shaded gardens. Triadenum purpureum is also valued for its ability to stabilize soil in woodland environments.
